meanings.definition: A metal loop with a spring-loaded gate used to quickly and reversibly connect components
meanings.sent1: I attached my keys to my belt loop using a carabiner.
meanings.sent2: Rock climbers always carry carabiners to secure themselves.
meanings.sent3: The carabiner decided to take up knitting as a hobby.
meanings.sent4: The carabiner of friendship kept us connected through thick and thin.
meanings.sent5: The shiny carabiner gleamed in the sunlight, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: To fasten or secure with a carabiner
meanings.sent1: I will carabiner my water bottle to my backpack for the hike.
meanings.sent2: She always carabiners her dog's leash to the fence when they go outside.
meanings.sent3: The magician carabinered the scarves together, creating a colorful chain.
meanings.sent4: His words carabinered her heart, holding it safe and secure.
meanings.sent5: The chef carabinered the recipe to the fridge to keep it from getting lost.
